comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Emilie Josephine Hutchinson wrote Women's Wages: A Study of the Wages of Industrial Women and Measures Suggested to Increase Them (Columbia University 1919).

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Pretty sure this is Aimee Hutchinson, a New York Catholic school teacher dismissed from her job for attending the 1912 suffrage parade. She was regarded as a suffrage martyr and went on to become a suffrage activist, and part of the "Suffrage Pure Foods Company" on Broadway. daytoninmanhattan.blogspot.com/2012/05/fanciful-queen-ann... contains a brief account of her activities.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
11418107@N02
comment._content: I like artolog's ID better!  Any chance they were related, I wonder?  Emilie and Aimee just seem like sisters' names to me, and they seem to have had overlapping interests.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: It's an intriguing thought. Here's some info on an Aimee Hutchinson of the right era, but no Emilie as a sibling: www.pennock.ws/surnames/fam/fam31361.html A photo of the suffragist Aimee H., but too dark to compare to this one: fultonhistory.com/Newspaper%2017/Dobbs%20Ferry%20NY%20%20...

comment.author: 34911459@N08
comment._content: artolog: thanks for the additional information.  We will update the record.
